title: Remarks by President Trump After 2018 Hurricane Briefing – The White House
content:
Remarks			

		Land & Agriculture	

Issued on:
June 6, 2018
FEMA HeadquartersWashington, D.C.3:05 P.M. EDTTHE PRESIDENT:  Well, thank you very much, everybody.  We just went through a briefing, and it’s very impressive, what’s taken place in the last short period of time.  We’ve never had a season like we had last season.  And what we went through is incredible.  And without you we couldn’t have done it.  We know how hard you work.And Brock and Secretary Nielsen, we really appreciate it.  We’re with our great First Lady and our great Vice President.I want to just say we very much respect the work you’ve done.  And the fact that you do it so well, so seamlessly.  We had a season last year like no other, in terms of the power, the level, the hurricanes, the fires along the West Coast.  We just really appreciate what you’ve been able to do.  Whether it’s in Texas or in Florida, in Puerto Rico.  You’re going to Louisiana, you’re going to Alabama, you’re going to places that really have not been hit like this.  You can be very, very proud of yourselves.   And I’m very proud to be with you.And speaking for Melania and Mike, we thank you all very much.  Great job.  Great job.  Thank you.  (Applause.)END3:07 P.M. EDT
